meanings.definition: Inflicted or brought about (damage or harm)
meanings.sent1: The storm wreaked havoc on the small town, destroying many homes.
meanings.sent2: The careless driver wreaked damage on the parked cars in the lot.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy wreaked chaos in the living room, scattering toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The virus wreaked havoc on the computer system, causing it to crash repeatedly.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire wreaked destruction on the forest, leaving behind a charred landscape.

meanings.definition: Caused or carried out (revenge or punishment)
meanings.sent1: The superhero wreaked justice on the villain, putting an end to his evil plans.
meanings.sent2: The angry mob wreaked vengeance on the traitor, seeking retribution for betrayal.
meanings.sent3: The prankster wreaked mischief on his friends, causing laughter instead of anger.
meanings.sent4: The ghostly figure wreaked terror on the unsuspecting travelers, haunting their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell wreaked magic on the enchanted castle, transforming it into a wonderland.
